intro: Cissampelos pareira var. klotzschii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow, spurred flowers. The plant produces small, green, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
